Re: Lapel pins
Now I know you have gone t© money and trouble designing
the lapel pins, but..
I don*t like the idea of using only a microphone for
an indication of NAE1 membership....
The mike lapel pin has been used by CIS and NIC since
the *30*s.
It has been used by every trade broadcasting school in
the U.S.
It has been used by every 250 watt station.
Why not be different?
Time is urgent if you want to introduce this pin at the
national convention, I know. But ©nee the pin is
"accepted", there will be no changing it.
If possible, I would suggest TV and rddio both be
"included" or neither be shown. If neither be shown,
use the U.S. map with the letters "NAEB" ©r if the
print would not be too small, use the complete
spelling.
Attached is a very rough suggestion. This could be
a blue flat U.S. map, with a raised (or flat, depending
on the price) mike and TV camera front with "connecting
cord" all in silver, with KAEB in black.
Question: I thought yellow and black were NAEB colors?
You asked what I thought?
